results.title: The Spanish conquest of the new world
results.brief_description: Covering the period from 1500 to 1550, this film surveys the explorations of Cortez, Pizarro, Balboa, De Soto and others, in California and South America. Stresses the contributions made by the Spanish to the western hemisphere - the use of horses and firearms to help subdue native Indians, the establishment of the Christian religion, the introduction of Spanish architecture in palaces, missions and cathedrals.

results.title: The Spanish apartment = L'Auberge Espagnole
results.creator_credit: Fox Searchlight Pictures, Ce Qui Me Meut, Bruno Levy and Cedric Klapisch
results.brief_description: Written and directed by Cedric Klapisch, “The Spanish Apartment”, a French/Spanish co-production, investigates the issue of whether or not a job makes us who we really are. In the quest to find a steady job, Xavier (Romain Duris) heads off to Spain for a year of post-graduate study leaving his girlfriend (Audrey Tautou) and mother behind in France. He meets a French married couple with whom he develops a friendship, particularly with the wife. Moving into a share-apartment with other students he acquires a broader knowledge of women and life from his friends and their lives there. Not only learning more on Spanish politics and economy he develops his knowledge of the Spanish language. Does he find himself though? Cast includes Judith Godreche, Cecile De France, Kelly Reilly, Christina Brondo, Federico D’Anna, Barnaby Metschurat, Christian Pagh, Kevin Bishop, Xavier De Guillebon.

results.title: The Span project
results.creator_credit: Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School and Keith Head
results.brief_description: The Melbourne suburb of Northcote is a typical egalitarian Australian community. Its residential areas were mainly settled between the wars and are now populated by a higher proportion of retired people than the suburban average. Northcote was chosen by the Brotherhood of St. Laurence as the site for an innovative program designed to involve local older people in self help welfare and community service. Once a week a dozen or so participants in the project run craft classes for local primary school children. Here the children are able to learn skills such as: woodwork; cookery; sewing; knitting; and crochet.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School and Keith Head

results.title: The Spag [released version]
results.brief_description: Director Giorgio Mangiamele produced the first examples of multicultural cinema in this country. ‘The Spag’ was shot in the streets of Carlton and tells the story of a newspaper boy working to support his widowed mother; along the way his life is fraught with racism. The film is Neo-Realist in style and makes interesting use of incidental music and post-sync dubbed dialogue track; a dog’s bark is even mimicked by an actor’s voice. Stars the young Terry Donovan.

results.title: The Spaces in Between
results.creator_credit: Carla Pascoe, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Carla Pascoe traces her family’s ancestry from Lebanon and contemplates the mysterious circumstances of her great grandfather’s migration, as well as the undocumented moments of her family’s history.

results.title: The Space movie
results.creator_credit: Tony Palmer, Simon Draper and Richard Branson
results.brief_description: The Space Movie contains footage especially made available by NASA and the US National Archive, and includes never before seen colour film of the lunar landscape, man’s historic first walk on the moon, Mars, Venus and beyond. Music by Mike Oldfield.

results.title: The Space between words: family (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: BBC-TV, KCET (Television station : Los Angeles, Calif.) and Roger Graef
results.brief_description: Families go for years without a serious talk of any kind. When crisis comes they may discover they have not really understood one another. A mother finds that her divorce began a series of problems with her teenage son. The family tries to discover how these difficulties developed, helped by a family therapist - Dr. Aaron Esterson.

results.title: The Space between words: diplomacy (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: BBC-TV, KCET (Television station : Los Angeles, Calif.) and Roger Graef
results.brief_description: Diplomats choose their words carefully. Everything they say in public commits their government. They need a private place to retreat to for hard bargaining. Diplomats call such bargaining “corridor work”. Filmed at the Palais des Nations in Geneva.

results.title: The Space between the door and the floor
results.creator_credit: Andrew O'Sullivan, Pauline Chan and AFTRS
results.brief_description: He sits alone in his office waiting for the girl of his dreams. When she comes, he will see her approach in the space between the bottom of the door and the floor. He lights a cigarette and waits … In the space between the door and the floor there lies a sliver of light in a dark world of fantasy and desire.

results.title: The Soya bean
results.creator_credit: Birch Hill Film Productions, Unilever Films and Dudley Birch
results.brief_description: Soya beans, one of the oldest crops of man, are still a major product today. Illinois, USA, with its rich soil, gives the highest yield in the world. We follow a crop from the ploughing, harrowing and sowing in April to the harvest in autumn. The beans are used for margarine, cooking fats and oils; the residue, being high in protein, is ideal for animal feed.
